questions: Are you the youngest, the oldest, the middle, or an only child? How has that experience shaped you?
Read Colossians 3:12-14. What is the root reason why we forgive one another? How can we maintain unity in the body even as disagreements occur?
Compassion combines the following: kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience. Which of these areas do you sense God wants to grow you in?
Read Colossians 3:15-17. What does it mean to do ‘whatever will bring about peace’? How can these verses guide us when we experience conflict with other believers?

The sermon reminded us that transformation doesn’t come from fear or guilt, but from knowing that we are dearly loved by God. How might your spiritual life or relationships look different if you truly lived from that motivation?

Read Colossians 3:17. What does it mean to be an authorized agent of the Lord Jesus? How does verse 17 restructure all of our relationships? Where do you see opportunities to bring Christ’s character into unjust or broken systems you’re part of?
How has your view of Christ changed as a result of this series? Can you identify ways that you are growing spiritually?

sections.title: Pray
sections.body: Pray that we would be filled with the knowledge of God and understanding of His will that comes from the Holy Spirit. Pray that we would grow in our hunger and desire for more of God. As we continue to reflect on this message, pray that we would be transformed more into the image of Jesus.

sections.title: Next Steps
sections.body: Check out the resources page for links to several Bible reading plans and other helpful tools. Explore other opportunities for growth and transformation by checking out courses.
